intro: Tragia sanjappae, commonly known as the Sanjappa tragia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of India. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in fine pubescence, aiding in water retention. Tragia sanjappae is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in scrublands and wastelands.
